title: Irregular sets carry full metric mean dimension. (arXiv:2210.16491v3 [math.DS] UPDATED)
description: Let $(X, d)$ be a compact metric space, $f: X \to X$ be a continuous transformation with the specification property and $\varphi: X \to \mathbb{R}$ be a continuous function. We consider the set (called the irregular set for $\varphi$) of points for which the Birkhoff average of $\varphi$ does not exist and show that this set is either empty or carries full Bowen upper and lower metric mean dimension.
dc:creator: Chunlin Liu, Xue Liu
